title: Romney says Trump's call to China and Ukraine to investigate Joe Biden 'wrong and appalling'
text:
Washington (CNN) Republican Sen. Mitt Romney of Utah rebuked President Donald Trump on Friday over the President's call for Ukraine and China to investigate the family of former Vice President Joe Biden.

"By all appearances, the President's brazen and unprecedented appeal to China and to Ukraine to investigate Joe Biden is wrong and appalling," Romney said in a statement on Friday.

Romney said, "When the only American citizen President Trump singles out for China's investigation is his political opponent in the midst of the Democratic nomination process, it strains credulity to suggest that it is anything other than politically motivated."

The criticism of Trump from a Republican senator comes as most congressional Republicans have remained silent over the past 24 hours and declined to speak out in opposition to the President's latest comments after Trump said on Thursday that he wants both Ukraine and China to investigate Joe Biden and his son.

Republican Sen. Ben Sasse of Nebraska, an occasional critic of Trump's who is running for reelection in that conservative state, has also pushed back on Trump's China comments.
